name: eric-oss-network-assurance-search
description: Network Assurance Search Microservice: Explore open search metric documents with a dashboard.

scripts.install:all: npm run install:root && npm run install:frontend && npm run install:server && npm run install:integration && npm run install:contract && npm run install:apiDocs
scripts.ci:all: npm run ci:root && concurrently npm:ci:frontend npm:ci:server npm:ci:integration npm:ci:contract npm:ci:apiDocs
scripts.clean: rm -rf node_modules && rm -rf frontend/node_modules && rm -rf backend/node_modules && rm -rf integration-tests/node_modules && rm -rf consumer-contract-tests/node_modules
scripts.outdated:all: npm run outdated:frontend && npm run outdated:server && npm run outdated:root && npm run outdated:integration && npm run outdated:contract && npm run outdated:apiDocs
scripts.update:all: npm run update:frontend && npm run update:server && npm run update:root && npm run update:integration && npm run update:contract && npm run update:apiDocs
scripts.lint:package-lock: lockfile-lint -p package-lock.json && lockfile-lint -p backend/package-lock.json && lockfile-lint -p frontend/package-lock.json && lockfile-lint -p integration-tests/package-lock.json
scripts.lint: npm run lint:frontend && npm run lint:server && npm run lint:markdown && npm run lint:package-lock && npm run lint:apiDocs
scripts.test:frontend: cd frontend && npm run test:install && nyc npm run test
scripts.test:contract:indexer: npm run test:generateContract:indexer && cd consumer-contract-tests && npm run test:contract:indexer
scripts.test:contract:cnom: cd frontend && npm run test:install && npm run test:contract
scripts.test:contract:all: npm run test:contract:indexer && npm run test:contract:cnom
scripts.standalone:dev: cd standalone && docker compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up --build
scripts.standalone:dev:cluster: cd standalone && docker compose -f docker-compose.dev.cluster.yml up --build
scripts.standalone:prod: cd standalone && docker compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml build --no-cache && docker compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
